title: Mesenchymal to epithelial transition in development and disease
publication_info: CL Chaffer, EW Thompson, ED Williams - Cells Tissues Organs, 2007 - karger.com
snippet:
Cellular plasticity is fundamental to embryonic development. The importance of cellular 
transitions in development is first apparent during gastrulation when the process of epithelial to 
mesenchymal transition transforms polarized epithelial cells into migratory mesenchymal cells …

title: [HTML][HTML] Mesenchymal stem/stromal cells (MSCs): role as guardians of inflammation
publication_info: DJ Prockop, JY Oh - Molecular therapy, 2012 - Elsevier
snippet:
Recent observations have demonstrated that one of the functions of mesenchymal stem/stromal 
cells (MSCs) is to serve as guardians against excessive inflammatory responses. One mode 
of action of the cells is that they are activated to express the interleukin (IL)-1 receptor …

title: [HTML][HTML] Mesenchymal stem cell-based immunomodulation: properties and clinical application
publication_info: M Wang, Q Yuan, L Xie - Stem cells international, 2018 - hindawi.com
snippet:
Mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) are multipotent stem cells characterized by self-renewal, 
production of clonal cell populations, and multilineage differentiation. They exist in nearly all 
tissues and play a significant role in tissue repair and regeneration. Additionally, MSCs …

title: Mesenchymal stem cell-based therapy
publication_info: V Mundra, IC Gerling, RI Mahato - Molecular pharmaceutics, 2013 - ACS Publications
snippet:
Mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) are multipotent adult stem cells which have self-renewal 
capacity and differentiation potential into several mesenchymal lineages including bones, 
cartilages, adipose tissues and tendons. MSCs may repair tissue injuries and prevent immune …

title: Mesenchymal stromal cell characteristics vary depending on their origin
publication_info: H Wegmeyer, AM Bröske, M Leddin… - Stem cells and …, 2013 - liebertpub.com
snippet:
Mesenchymal stromal cells (MSCs) are rare progenitor cells that can be isolated from various 
tissues. They exhibit multilineage differentiation potential, support regenerative processes, 
and interact with various immune cells. Therefore, MSCs represent a promising tool for …

title: How mesenchymal stem cells interact with tissue immune responses
publication_info: Y Shi, J Su, AI Roberts, P Shou, AB Rabson… - Trends in immunology, 2012 - Elsevier
snippet:
Mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs), also called multipotent mesenchymal stromal cells, exist in 
almost all tissues and are a key cell source for tissue repair and regeneration. Under pathological 
conditions, such as tissue injury, these cells are mobilized towards the site of damage. …

title: Mesenchymal–epithelial interactions: past, present, and future
snippet:
This review summarizes the history of research on mesenchymal–epithelial interactions in 
prostatic development from the first studies in 1970 to the present. From this study we have 
learned that prostatic development requires a reciprocal interaction between epithelium and …
